quotes.quote: We experience moments absolutely free from worry. These brief respites are called panic.
Panic causes tunnel vision. Calm acceptance of danger allows us to more easily assess the situation and see the options.
A financial panic is a very bad thing, but a government panic can do far greater damage in a far shorter time.
Panic implies that there is no rational thought taking place. That we are frozen and incapable of adjusting. Powerless to logic, and subject to seemingly unthinkable behavior.
If you panic that's a good way to lose. You have to stay in control.
Panic is a sudden desertion of us, and a going over to the enemy of our imagination.
Panic is not an effective long-term organizing strategy.
Panic is an incredibly catalyzing creative force. And almost out of sheer necessity, I found I had to talk about myself and my real life as it is effectively lived by me.
There's no panic like the panic you momentarily feel when your hand or head is stuck in something.
Panic is the sudden realization that everything around you is alive.
Depression is anger slowed down; panic is grief speeded up.
Panic is the great access of creativity because that's the only way to get rid of your mind.
Panic is highly contagious, especially in situations when nothing is known and everything is in flux.
If you're tearing around in a panic about something, then it puts everyone else in a panic as well.
Panic, a deep abiding, free-floating anxiety, often without any reason or logical basis.
